intro: Echinocereus rigidissimus var. rubispinus, commonly known as the red-spined hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the deserts of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a columnar cactus with a distinctive red or reddish-brown spines that give it its common name. The plant features areoles, which are specialized stem structures from which spines, flowers, and branches emerge. It produces bright yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and moths. This plant is well adapted to arid environments, with a deep root system and a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss.
